text:
The weekend is finally here and as always there are amazing things happening just around the corner from Cass Business School. This weekend the @barbicancentre is holding its annual OpenFest, this year the festival explores what it means to be British through the works of artists from around the UK.

text: Shared from our exhibition which looks back at the founding and early years of City: The first Principal of the Institute, Dr Robert Mullineux Walmsley was appointed and commenced his duties in January 1896. An important figure in the development of the Northampton Institute, Walmsley pioneered the ‚Äúsandwich‚Äù course, where study was combined with placement in industry. Walmsley often personally arranged placements, even visiting students in their workshops. Aeronautical Engineering and Optics courses became well established during Walmsley‚Äôs principalship. Find out more about "Mully" including these facinating testimonials from former colleagues in part 1 of the exhibition: The Story of City Life, Learning, Legacy running until July. #City125 #Archives #History #London
linkedText: Shared from our exhibition which looks back at the founding and early years of City: The first Principal of the Institute, Dr Robert Mullineux Walmsley was appointed and commenced his duties in January 1896. An important figure in the development of the Northampton Institute, Walmsley pioneered the ‚Äúsandwich‚Äù course, where study was combined with placement in industry. Walmsley often personally arranged placements, even visiting students in their workshops. Aeronautical Engineering and Optics courses became well established during Walmsley‚Äôs principalship. Find out more about "Mully" including these facinating testimonials from former colleagues in part 1 of the exhibition: The Story of City Life, Learning, Legacy running until July. @City125 @Archives @History @London

text: This beautiful envelope is around 125 years old. It contained the instructions to architects and the specifications for building the Mountford (now College) building. On the following page you can see the request for a well lit swimming bath with suitable dressing rooms around 3 sides. You can still see some of the existing changing cubicals today in the Law Law College Building which fills the spot of the old Pool. You can view these documents in our current exhibition The Story of City: life, learning, legacy. #City125 #archives #oldLondon #cityuniversityofLondon #paper #architecture
linkedText: This beautiful envelope is around 125 years old. It contained the instructions to architects and the specifications for building the Mountford (now College) building. On the following page you can see the request for a well lit swimming bath with suitable dressing rooms around 3 sides. You can still see some of the existing changing cubicals today in the Law Law College Building which fills the spot of the old Pool. You can view these documents in our current exhibition The Story of City: life, learning, legacy. @City125 @archives @oldLondon @cityuniversityofLondon @paper @architecture

text: Today we feed two birds with one scone, combining a #marblemonday with an exclusive from our exhibition The story of City: life, learning, legacy. This impressive financial ledger from 1891 had no key and remained locked for many years (which has kept it well preserved). Recently unlocked and on display in our exhibition, the selected page shows the honoraria paid to each architect for entering the competition to submit a design for the Mountford Building. Do you know who won? #city125 #cityuniversityoflondon #archives #marbledmonday
linkedText: Today we feed two birds with one scone, combining a @marblemonday with an exclusive from our exhibition The story of City: life, learning, legacy. This impressive financial ledger from 1891 had no key and remained locked for many years (which has kept it well preserved). Recently unlocked and on display in our exhibition, the selected page shows the honoraria paid to each architect for entering the competition to submit a design for the Mountford Building. Do you know who won? @city125 @cityuniversityoflondon @archives @marbledmonday

text:
Have you visited our Exhibition The Story of City : life, learning and legacy? Today we share an online exclusive.

The proposed Northampton Institute Key Plan of Site Shewing Positions of Station Points for Perspectives. 4th August 1892.

This plan shows the awkward triangular site that the building would occupy.¬†The site was donated by William Compton, the fourth Marquis of Northampton¬†and¬†his son, William, Earl Compton.¬†An article written at the time in The Builder notes ‚ÄúThe site was a difficult one to treat, owing to its shape‚Ä¶though apart from this it is a fine site, with good frontages in each direction.‚Äù The blue area shows vacant land, the pink area was yet to be acquired, and on the yellow area was tenanted at the start of the¬†building process. #archives #maps #clerkenwell #islington #cityuniversity #oldlondon #city125 #heritage
linkedText: Have you visited our Exhibition The Story of City : life, learning and legacy? Today we share an online exclusive. The proposed Northampton Institute Key Plan of Site Shewing Positions of Station Points for Perspectives. 4th August 1892. This plan shows the awkward triangular site that the building would occupy.¬†The site was donated by William Compton, the fourth Marquis of Northampton¬†and¬†his son, William, Earl Compton.¬†An article written at the time in The Builder notes ‚ÄúThe site was a difficult one to treat, owing to its shape‚Ä¶though apart from this it is a fine site, with good frontages in each direction.‚Äù The blue area shows vacant land, the pink area was yet to be acquired, and on the yellow area was tenanted at the start of the¬†building process. @archives @maps @clerkenwell @islington @cityuniversity @oldlondon @city125 @heritage

text: To celebrate 125 years of City, we present our first exhibition, The Story of City: Life, learning and legacy. On display are documents and objects which tell a story about the origins of City, then known as the Northampton Institute. You can view the exhibition in University Building Pavilion until the end of the year.
linkedText: To celebrate 125 years of City, we present our first exhibition, The Story of City: Life, learning and legacy. On display are documents and objects which tell a story about the origins of City, then known as the Northampton Institute. You can view the exhibition in University Building Pavilion until the end of the year.
